data_usage: Decadal average precipitation anomalies (difference between the decade and the 1901-1960 average precipitation) for the contiguous U.S were plotted as a bar graph. Note: the far right bar contains data for 12 years (2001-2012).
methodology: Annual total precipitation amounts were averaged for all gridpoints in the contiguous U.S. Decadal averages were then calculated. Finally the 1901-1960 average precipitation amount was subtracted from the decadal average amount, and a percentage change in precipitation was calculated.
notes: IDL was used to perform numerical calculations and to visualize the data.
output_artifacts:
temp_precip_seasonal_averages.pro
conus.ave.prcp
temp_precip_decadal_averages.pro
US.dec_avg.precip_ANN.txt
temp_precip_decadal_barchart.pro
US_precip_anom_1901-2012_ANN.eps
